page.title: 16INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content:
{Gordon Milne - Leicester City F.C. {Manager. Appointed August 2nd 1982
Gordon has lived in Burbage since 1972 with his wife and three sons. He began playing football at Preston Primary School. He played little other sport and eventually became an apprentice footballer for Preston North-End where his father was coach and trainer. His idol was Tom Finney. At the height of his career he played for Liverpool reaching the Cup Final but missing it through injury.He was capped for England and the most memorable game of his career was against Brazil at the Maratana Stadium in front of 135000 people. Gordon, formerly manager of Coventry is enjoying his job and sees no reason to move.Despite crowd trouble he still passionately loves the game.
